meanings.definition: A book size resulting from folding a sheet of paper into eight leaves.
meanings.sent1: The library had many octavos on its shelves.
meanings.sent2: She bought a beautiful octavos to add to her collection.
meanings.sent3: The octavos were so tiny, they looked like little booklets.
meanings.sent4: His love for reading was as vast as the number of octavos in the bookstore.
meanings.sent5: The octavos were neatly arranged in rows, showcasing their compact size.

meanings.definition: A sheet of paper folded into eight leaves.
meanings.sent1: He found a stack of octavos on the desk.
meanings.sent2: She carefully folded the paper into octavos for the project.
meanings.sent3: The octavos were scattered all over the floor after the mishap.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the octavos away, creating a paper trail.
meanings.sent5: The teacher handed out the octavos for the students to work on.

meanings.definition: A book composed of octavo sheets.
meanings.sent1: The author's latest work was published as an octavos.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the old octavos with their yellowed pages.
meanings.sent3: The octavos lined up on the bookshelf like soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library filled with memories bound in octavos.
meanings.sent5: The antique store had a rare collection of octavos from the 1800s.
